intro: Dorotheanthus bellidiformis subsp. hestermalensis, commonly known as the Hesternal dorotheanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with a distinctive, bell-shaped structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
